msContents.summary: The text named Viśvaprakāśa is composed by Maheśvara suri in the year 1111 (12th Cen. AD). The manuscript mentions it as Viśvanighaṇḍu at the beginning and also at the end. In the colophon the title is mentioned as Viśvaprakāśikā as well. The Colophon does not mention the month it was completed. It only mentions that it was wriiten in an intercalated month (Adhikamāsa/ Malamāsa/Mīnamāsa) of a Plava saṃvatsara. Front Cover -hariḥ oṃ śubhamastu Viśvanikhaṇḍu and something scribbled on the blank folio before 1v. 1r has in the left margin hariḥ oṃ (1r 1) ādau vatalola govindo ravindrananayana … (1r 4) madāsarājatyāgarudavapuṇyaśrita .. The end blank folio has hariḥ oṃ.

additions.desc: hariḥ oṃ śubhamastu is written on front cover.
Viśvaprakāśikā is written in the left margin of the 1v.

origin.origDate: The colophon says that the manucscript was completed on Siravāsara 14th Day of the Malamāsa of the Plava saṃvatsara. According to the colophon the aprroximate date of the manuscript is -- It was written on the Sunaday the 14 day of the intercalated month in the year 1901-1902 CE. The manuscript belongs to the Rāghavācārya who is the grand son of the Vīrarāghavācārya who belongs to the Bhāradvāja lineage.
